content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with a potential tenant named Haoyu Wang.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of this conversation was about the rental price of an apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why not? And how did you handle the disagreement?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] No, we did not agree on a final price. I offered the apartment at 800 Euros per month, which I considered a fair price given the location and facilities. However, the potential tenant was hoping for a price that reflected the true value of the apartment, which I believed was already reflected in the offered price. I terminated the negotiation because I had already offered the lowest price I could offer.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner as 7. There were disagreements, but the conversation was respectful and courteous.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] No, there was no indication of discrimination or offense in the conversation.
name: Peter Schmidt
